boat.name: Devon Maid
boat.full_description:
Originally a dayboat, 'Devon Maid' had a coachroof added in the 1930s. During the Second World War she was sunk as part of a barrage.

In 1958 she was found sailing in the Alderney Race with no-one on board and was taken to Guernsey by the pilots, one of whom was the uncle of David Bisson, who owned her in 2014. She took part in the first OGA Solent Race in 1959 under her then owner, Fiona Beale, who then took her to the Helford River, which has been her home port ever since.

Fiona Beale owned her for 50 years.
boat.construction_details: Larch and Cedar on oak, copper fastened.
boat.short_description: Devon Maid was built at Belsize Boatyard on the River Itchen from off-cuts from their steam yachts, mainy larch with some cedar and oak. She raced in the first OGA Solent Race, 1959.
